summary: the whale , named varvara , swam nearly 14,000 miles ( 22,500 kilometers ) . it said the previous record was set by a humpback whale that swam a mere 10,190-mile round trip between the `` warm breeding waters of the arctic and antarctic regions '' .
aspect: 1. North Pacific gray whale named Varvara sets record for longest migration of a mammal. 2. Varvara traveled nearly 14,000 miles, more than double the previous record. 3. Varvara's journey might reveal new information about gray whale populations and migration patterns.
explain: North Pacific gray whale named Varvara sets a new record for the longest mammal migration, covering nearly 14,000 miles. The journey has the potential to reveal new information about gray whale populations and migration patterns.
